primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God pursues and overwhelms both the self-righteous (Jonah) and the ignorant/wicked (Nineveh) with an unmerited mercy that transcends human logic and desert.

tekstueel_bewijs: God has overwhelmed Jonah with grace and kindness
God causes a nice green plant to grow
God has consigned all men to disobedience, in order that he may have mercy upon all
He repented of the evil which he said he would do to them
For thy own sake, O Lord
a gracious God and merciful, slow to anger and abounding in steadfast love
for thy city and thy people are called by thy name
we as a congregation... are like the people of Nineveh
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is explicitly invited to identify with the Receiver (the Ninevites) rather than the Subject.

helper.identificatie: The Word/Prophecy and the 'Tricks' of Providence (Plant/Worm)
tekstueel_bewijs: God plays another trick on Jonah
the unknown author has taught a lesson
helper.rol_van_god: God is both Subject and the source of Help.
helper.rol_van_geest: External help through the 'sly' pedagogical actions of God.

tekstueel_bewijs: Jonah is beside himself with outrage
not knowing their right hand from their left
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is the universal human condition of disobedience (Rom 11:32) which requires a divine 'Subject-switch' to overcome.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human response of repentance and prayer in light of God's character.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Congregation/Daniel
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The human 'action' (kneeling/praying) is a response to the primary program of God's established mercy.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God has overwhelmed Jonah with grace
God has consigned all men to disobedience
The Lord had mercy upon the people of Nineveh
voorbeelden_mens_subject: I invite you to join me

voorbeelden: Jonah would have been delighted to prophesy destruction
people... have no idea what the theological message... is
God... did not do it [the evil]
how much more will he turn evil away from them

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on God's 'Pouvoir' (Power/Ability) to save despite human 'Savoir' (ignorance) or 'Vouloir' (rebellion).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the 'righteous' Jonah (~S1) and 'wicked' Nineveh (~S2) to the realization that both are under S2, only to be subsumed by God's S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: God 'repents' of S2, moving all actants into the sphere of S1 (Grace).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; sin is described as 'egregious' and 'rebellious', requiring divine intervention.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently places God as the active Subject who initiates, sustains, and completes the act of mercy, while humans are the passive or resistant beneficiaries.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Potential Exemplarism in the 'two parts' we play
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: We play both the parts at different times in our lives.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as the Subject of active verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God has overwhelmed Jonah with grace and kindness.
We do not present our supplications... on the ground of our righteousness, but on the ground of thy great mercy.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Jonah is used as a 'negative' example of the human heart, but the focus is on God's reaction to him, not Jonah's imitation.
bijbelse_figuren_als_model: Jonah (as a mirror of our own resistance)
Ninevites (as a mirror of our need)
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides a theocentric reading: God is the one who deals with both the 'Jonah' and 'Ninevite' in us.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and humility; 'comforting beyond all expectation'.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic grace; salvation is entirely God's work for the 'pitiful'.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The primary program (God's mercy) perfectly grounds the secondary program (the prayer of Daniel).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: God... repenting of the evil that he had every right to bring down upon my head.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses on the Father/Son (implied) action rather than the internal work of the Spirit.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; sin is 'rebellion' and 'wickedness' that deserves 'hellfire and damnation'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a masterclass in theocentric narrative. God is the Subject of almost every significant action.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is appropriate for a sermon on Jonah 4.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A profound example of how to use humor and narrative to dismantle human ego and replace it with the Subjectivity of God.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'humor' as a tool; semiotics shows the humor is actually a 'Helper' in the actantial shift from Law to Grace.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Assyrians; semiotics explains why the hearer *is* an Assyrian in the story's deep structure.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Subject' of the sermon is not the preacher or the hearer's effort, but the 'sly' mercy of God.

volledige_subject_lijst: God (spoke, causes, sends, delivers, overwhelmed, consigned, had mercy)
appendices.notities: The sermon uses the Daniel prayer to transition the hearer from a 'Subject' of their own life to a 'Receiver' of God's action.
